result.execSummary:
The defendant Yousefmon Patrick Marshall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT: Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and fees by 9/26/16 or be docketed as a civil judgment. Court ordered report date be 10/1/15 by 5:00 pm.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 3 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Yousefmon Patrick Marshall
Current: 3757 N. 15th St., Milwaukee, WI 53206 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2016)
Prior: 3709 North 15th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Yousefmon Patrick Marshall in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1 & 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Yousefmon Patrick Marshall in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Due to Court congestion, and suggestion to spin case.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Yousefmon Patrick Marshall in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Uon Request For A New Court Date received and filed with court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Yousefmon Patrick Marshall in court with attorney Paul J. Manley as a friend of the Court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference. For reasons stated on the record, Defendant needs additional time to retain private counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37. Defendant taken into custody for city of milwaukee citations.  Status conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Weapons Order, No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Status conference scheduled for 06-03-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Yousefmon Patrick Marshall

Defendant Yousefmon Patrick Marshall in court.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.37  for a Status Conference.vb
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on  5-19-2015 at 1:30pm
